channel.title: Posts on Gabriel Voelcker
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Gabriel Voelcker

item.title: Working Paper #1: My Masters Dissertation
item.description: As I near the end of my masters, I decided to share the working paper based on my dissertation. It is centered around the hypothesis: are family firms more averse to risk-taking than non-family firms

item.title: Stand
item.description: My name is Gabriel Voelcker and I am, among other things, an economist. I hope to use this netlify as a place to formalize my ideas, improve my coding skills and, last but not least, connect with other people who share interests with me.

item.title: About the author
item.description: I am an economist from Brazil. My alma mater is Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul, and I graduated in 2016. I am currently finishing my masters in Accounting at Universidade do Vale do Rio dos Sinos. My main research interests include: econometrics, microeconomics, disclosure, disclosure regulation, game theory, risk, behavioural economics, decision-making, cultural economics and dividend policy. You can find everything I have published in my Google Scholar page, although I havenâ€™t many contributions yet.
